H0.text: Luster is the property the student has observed about the unidentified mineral sample that can scratch gypsum but is unable to scratch quartz.

H1.text: Hardness is the property of the unidentified mineral sample that the student observes, as it can scratch gypsum but cannot scratch quartz.

H2.text: Density is the property the student has observed about an unidentified mineral sample that can scratch gypsum but cannot scratch quartz.

H3.text: Reactivity is the property the student has observed when the unidentified mineral sample scratches gypsum but not quartz.

A4.text: The Mohs scale (  MOHZ) of mineral hardness is a qualitative ordinal scale, from 1 to 10, characterizing scratch resistance of minerals through the ability of harder material to scratch softer material.
